thread.title_full: Evel: Scottish MPs could be barred from voting on Heathrow's third runway (From Herald Scotland)

author: Kate Devlin
title: Evel: Scottish MPs could be barred from voting on Heathrow's third runway
text:
Scottish MPs could be barred from a future vote on a third runway at Heathrow.
The Leader of the House Chris Grayling said that the issue could be branded 'England-only'.
His comments came just hours before a crunch vote on controversial plans for 'English votes for English laws' (evel).
First Minister Nicola Sturgeon has said that her party will vote in the best interests of Scots on airport expansion.
But Mr Grayling suggested that the SNP could be prevented from taking part in a new stage in which only English MPs would vote.
Mr Grayling said that votes on flight slots or airspace capacity would be done "on a UK-wide basis".
However, if the vote was about a planning application "it might be very different", he said.
English MPs have been promised a veto on any legislation which does not affect the rest of the UK.
Share article The SNP, Labour and other parties warn the plans do not take into account significant 'knock-on' effects in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.
They oppose Evel which they warn could create a tier of 'second class MPs'.
